Posts.Title: Near total continence 8 days post op--is this possible?

Posts.Content: Hi Mike, here are some of my results. I had surgery in July. My incontinence is/was very slight; I only used pads for less than a week and really didn't need them that long. I only had problems with coughing, laughing, etc. and then only a drop or two. I do have a relapse once every 2-3 weeks, but you learn to clamp down when you feel a cough/sneeze coming on. I don't even do Kagels any more. At 3 months post op I was doing things like I did pre op; no problems. I do still have significant ED problems; I haven't had an unaided erection since, but only one nerve bundle was spared. Orgasms are maybe a little less intense, but dry.

Posts.Content: I've just had a 16-month post RALP checkup and things have been going well otherwise. All previous PSA tests have been 0.01, but this time it is 0.03. Should I be concerned with this increase? I haven't talked to the surgeon yet; don't want to bother if its no big deal. Thanks
Posts.Signature: 60 YO Rising PSA-1.3 to 3.7 over the last 3 years prior to surgery Biopsy-4/9/13; Gleason 7 (4+3) w/ ter. pattern 5; 6 of 12 cores positive, all on left side; PE present; stage T1c DaVinci surgery 7/9/13 by Dr. Scott Tully, Urology Clinics of AL (B'ham); nerve bundle on one side spared Pathology - prostate-24 grams, 44.5cc; Gleason-7 (4+3); 50% of prostate involved; PE present; margins neg.; no sem. ves. invasion; lymph/vascular invasion present; PNI present; lymph nodes not involved; pT3aN0M0. Posts.Title: 16 months post RALP

Posts.Content: Hello all, new member here. I was diagnosed with PC back in April, Gleason 7 (4+3), T1c. Had RP via da Vinci on July 9, 2013; catheter removed 1 week later. After 1.5 weeks I quit using pads; I'd say I'm 99% continent now; just a drop or two a few times a week. Pathology report: Gleason 7 (4+3); T3a I will have my first PSA test in mid Oct One concern right now is that my left testicle is still sore to the touch after 2 months; no swelling. The tumor was on the left side of prostate. Anyone have testicular pain at 2 months? Otherwise, no pain of any kind after about a month. Thanks, Eddie
Posts.Title: 2 months post-op (new member) w/testicle pain

Posts.Content: Thanks guys, the soreness is intermittent; today I noticed it very little, while yesterday it was rather annoying. But it has definitely subsided since surgery. I've got a call in with the surgeon, so we'll see what he says. When it is bothersome, it does feel like the epididymis is swollen; anyway that is where it hurts.
Posts.Title: 2 months post-op (new member) w/testicle pain

Posts.Content: I'm nine months post Da Vinci. Everything has gone well; very little incontinence, but still no firm erections; but sufficient for penetration. However, since surgery when having orgasms I feel some discomfort/pain in my rectum around the sphincter; not that intense though. It goes away seconds after orgasm. Has anyone experienced this?

Posts.Title: Rectal pain at orgasm?

Posts.Content: I have my 3 month checkup on Tuesday and will get my first post-op PSA test done. I don't think I'm scared as such but very apprehensive of what the results may bring. I've been doing very well; very, very little incontinence but still no unaided erection. So I really don't want to have anything slow down my recovery. I'm trying very hard (and usually succeeding) to be positive.

Posts.Title: Three month checkup on Tuesday

Posts.Content: Well, maybe I'm not so crazy afterall. I, too, have dreams of peeing. Mostly, I wake up and go to the bathroom, but once, about a year post RALP, I peed all over myself in bed. Now, two years post I'm about 99.9% dry. Congratulations on your good report.

Posts.Title: First post-op PSA results

Posts.Content: Update. I posted back in May that my PSA had risen from 0.03 to 0.05 and the surgeon rescheduled my next test for 3 instead of 6 months. Well, I had the test done last Wednesday and learned Friday that my PSA has risen again to 0.1; so doubled in the last 3 months. He says I have recurrence and should start salvage radiation therapy but said hormone therapy is not indicated. So, I have a consult with the radiation oncologist at my surgeon's urology group in Birmingham, AL (Urology Centers of Alabama) on Sept. 2. The problem is Birmingham is 2 hours away making it necessary to spend weekdays there. That's not such a problem in that I'm retired and they offer free lodging (I also have a travel trailer and a nice state park is about 15 minutes away). But, I'd rather have it done locally at the East AL Medical Center in Opelika, AL if the equipment/personnel are equal. From what I can tell on their websites, both use IMRT/IGRT equipment. My questions to you: 1. What are the questions to ask each center to determine who has the latest/best equipment and experience? 2. While I don't want HT and the surgeon says its not indicated, should I be concerned NOT to have it? 3. Should I ask for bone/abdominal scans or are my numbers too low to pick up? 3. Any other questions that I should ask? I must say I have had a variety of emotions since Friday; not many of which are pleasant; add to that, my mother has moderate Alzheimer's and is driving me nuts. Thank you all for any assistance. This is a great forum.
Posts.Signature: 60 YO Rising PSA-1.3 to 3.7 over the last 3 years prior to surgery Biopsy-4/9/13; Gleason 7 (4+3) w/ ter. pattern 5; 6 of 12 cores positive, all on left side; PE present; stage T1c DaVinci surgery 7/9/13 by Dr. Scott Tully, Urology Clinics of AL (B'ham); nerve bundle on one side spared Pathology - prostate-24 grams, 44.5cc; Gleason-7 (4+3); 50% of prostate involved; PE present; margins neg.; no sem. ves. invasion; lymph/vascular invasion present; PNI present; lymph nodes not involved; pT3aN0M0. Post-op PSA: 10/2013 - 0.01; 1/2014 - 0.01; 4/2014 - 0.01; 11/2014 - 0.03; 5/2015 - 0.05; 8/2015 - 0.1.

Posts.Title: Rising PSA (again) post RP - questions

Posts.Title: Rising PSA (again) post RP - questions

Posts.Content: The local cancer clinic (East AL Med. Center) doesn't list their machine but issues this statement which sounds pretty much like the Varian Clinac: "We have a state-of-the-art linear accelerator (the machine that delivers radiation therapy) with on-board imaging and respiratory gating so our radiation oncologist can precisely target cancer cells while minimizing damage to healthy tissues nearby, and accounting for the motion of the patient’s breathing." The RO at EAMC has 24 years experience. Still researching; thanks for all your input.
Posts.Signature: 60 YO Rising PSA-1.3 to 3.7 over the last 3 years prior to surgery Biopsy-4/9/13; Gleason 7 (4+3) w/ ter. pattern 5; 6 of 12 cores positive, all on left side; PE present; stage T1c DaVinci surgery 7/9/13 by Dr. Scott Tully, Urology Clinics of AL (B'ham); nerve bundle on one side spared Pathology - prostate-24 grams, 44.5cc; Gleason-7 (4+3); 50% of prostate involved; PE present; margins neg.; no sem. ves. invasion; lymph/vascular invasion present; PNI present; lymph nodes not involved; pT3aN0M0. Posts.Title: Rising PSA (again) post RP - questions

Posts.Content: Update on the update!!! After talking to the RO's at the local hospital and Urology Centers of Alabama in B'ham, I've decided to go with Urology Centers. Both use the same Varian Clinac machine. What swayed my decision: 1) UCA focuses primarily on prostate cases and the local hospital does all kinds of cancer, 2) UCA uses fiducials versus lining up on bone structure, 3) I just feel more comfortable at UCA since they did my RP. Both recommended around 68 Gy in 39 fractions; both RO's said HT is not indicated. So, next Tuesday I get fiducials implanted and the following Tuesday I get a CT scan and simulation. It will be sometime in October before I can get worked into the rotation for actual treatments. A huge burden has been lifted off my shoulders by just making this decision and getting a plan to follow. I also just became a grandfather for the first time on Sept. 6. The little fellow was 4 weeks premature; my daughter had to be induced early because of very high blood pressure. He spent a week in NICU due to respiratory problems, but came home this past Monday. Mom and son are doing very well. I'm one happy grandpa!!!

Posts.Title: Rising PSA numbers post RALP and post RT

Posts.Content: Its been a while since I've checked in here. I am 5 years post RALP and 2.5 years post RT. My first PSA results (every 6 mo.) were all 0.03; however, the last two were 0.07 and 0.09. Am I at the point where I should be concerned? I am worried but should I be?
Posts.Signature: 60 YO Rising PSA-1.3 to 3.7 over the last 3 years prior to surgery Biopsy-4/9/13; Gleason 7 (4+3) w/ ter. pattern 5; 6 of 12 cores positive, all on left side; PE present; stage T1c DaVinci surgery 7/9/13 by Dr. Scott Tully, Urology Clinics of AL (B'ham); nerve bundle on one side spared Pathology - prostate-24 grams, 44.5cc; Gleason-7 (4+3); 50% of prostate involved; PE present; margins neg.; no sem. ves. invasion; lymph/vascular invasion present; PNI present; lymph nodes not involved; pT3aN0M0. Post-op PSA: 10/2013 - 0.01; 1/2014 - 0.01; 4/2014 - 0.01; 11/2014 - 0.03; 5/2015 - 0.05; 8/2015 - 0.1.
Posts.Title: Rising PSA numbers post RALP and post RT
